intro: Chrysophthalmum, commonly known as the golden eye or sun eye plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers consist of a central disk surrounded by ray florets, which resemble small eyes, giving it its common name. Chrysophthalmum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
